name: (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(4,7,7-trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl)propan-1-imine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-878
Reason: 1,1-propanediamine has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for our comparison will be ethane, which has a melting point of -172.0 degrees Celsius. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a hydroxyl group, a methyl group, and two additional phenyl rings. The hydroxyl group introduces a hydrogen bonding potential, which can raise the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure and a slight increase in molecular weight, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The additional phenyl groups contribute to an increase in molecular weight and pi-pi interactions, estimated at approximately +100 degrees Celsius each.
